text: Sahl ibn Sa'd al-Sa'idi (سهل بن سعد) was one of the prominent Sahaba, or direct companions of the Islamic prophet Muhammad, a member of the Ansar Narrators and an early Muslim scholar. He died in 91 AH. He was born as a Muslim, he narrated 188 hadeth's.USC-MSA Compendium of Muslim Texts ==References== Category:710 deaths Category:Year of birth unknown Category:Companions of the Prophet
title: Sahl ibn Sa'd
